comment.author: 9856200@N04
comment._content: Part of the Carver neighborhood of Richmond, Virginia is pictured in this photo.  The white faced building in the lower left quadrant stood at the corner of West Marshall and Bowe Streets.  North Lombardy Street recedes into the distance at the top of the photo.  Maggie Walker High School stands at the corner of North Lombardy and West Leigh Streets at the left edge of the photo.

comment.author: 15705594@N00
comment._content:
The buildings along the north side of Marshall including the white one mentioned above were the Friedman-Marks Clothing Co. factory., which made "Rockingham" men's clothes and suits. IT later evolved into the Jefferson Clothing Co and the first Jefferson Factory Outlet was in the area.

The railroad tracks in the center are part of the old RF&P Bolton Yard.

The 4-5 story light colored building at the lower right of the photo was a warehouse for Brooks Transfer and Storage at 1224 West Broad. The building was built  in the early 1920's as the headquarters for the Pepsi-Cola Company, which was headquartered there from 1923 to 1931, when the company went bankrupt and it's assets sold to Charles Guth of the Luft Candy Company.
